thread.title: Private investors clamour for Lloyds Bank shares
thread.title_full: Private investors clamour for Lloyds Bank shares

title: Private investors clamour for Lloyds Bank shares
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Private investors clamour for Lloyds Bank shares The Lloyds retail sale will be the biggest privatisation in over two decades Peter Macdiarmid/Getty Images Philip Aldrick in Lima and Katherine Griffiths Lima Published 1 minute ago 
More than 250,000 members of the public have applied for shares in the government’s planned sale of £2 billion of Lloyds Banking Group stock. 
Interest has far exceeded that of the Royal Mail share sale, which drew 53,000 applications in the 16 days the tender was open. The chancellor started the Lloyds retail sale at the Conservative party conference four days ago and it will be the biggest privatisation in more than 20 years. 
“There is clearly an appetite for this among the British public,” he said yesterday at the International Monetary Fund’s annual meeting in Lima. Hargreaves Lansdown, the Subscribe now
